methods.name: Zone
methods.description: A Zone object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine zone.

examples.code: zone.exists(function(err, exists) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.code: zone.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: createDisk
methods.description: Create a persistent disk in this zone.

params.name: config.os
params.description: • Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See this list of accepted OS names.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: createVM
methods.description: Create a virtual machine in this zone.

examples.caption: Create a new instance using the latest Debian version as the source image for a new boot disk.
The above object will auto-expand behind the scenes to something like the following. The Debian version may be different when you run the command.

params.name: config.networkInterfaces
params.description: • An array of configurations for this interface. This specifies how this interface should interact with other network services, such as connecting to the internet. Default: [ { network: 'global/networks/default' } ]

params.name: config.machineType
params.description: • The machine type resource to use. Provide only the name of the machine, e.g. n1-standard-16. Refer to Available Machine Types. Default: n1-standard-1

params.name: config.os
params.description: • Specify the name of an OS, and we will use the latest version as the source image of a new boot disk. See this list of accepted OS names.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.operation
params.description: • An operation object that can be used to check the status of the request.

methods.name: disk
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine disk in this zone.

examples.code: var disk = zone.disk('disk1');

methods.name: getDisks
methods.description: Get a list of disks in this zone.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the disks from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.filter
params.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this can be a regular expression.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: getOperations
methods.description: Get a list of operations for this zone.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the operations from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.filter
params.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this can be a regular expression.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: getVMs
methods.description: Get a list of VM instances in this zone.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the VM instances from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.filter
params.description:
• Search filter in the format of {name} {comparison} {filterString}.
    • name: the name of the field to compare
    • comparison: the comparison operator, eq (equal) or ne (not equal)
    • filterString: the string to filter to. For string fields, this can be a regular expression.

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: operation
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine zone operation.

examples.code: var operation = zone.operation('operation-1445532685163-8b137d2a-1822afe7');

methods.name: vm
methods.description: Get a reference to a Google Compute Engine virtual machine instance.

examples.code: var vm = zone.vm('vm-name');

methods.name: createHttpServerFirewall_
methods.description: This method attempts to create a firewall rule to allow tcp:80 connections.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • If the firewall couldn't be created and it didn't already exist.

methods.name: createHttpsServerFirewall_
methods.description: This method attempts to create a firewall rule to allow tcp:443 connections.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • If the firewall couldn't be created and it didn't already exist.
